page.title: 03CLUBS
page.content: 1 There are 1607 members belonging to Hythe and District Social Club. It costs Â£3 for men, Â£1.50 for women and nothing for OAP's. The Club is a Working Men's Club set up by the trade unionists in 1931. Although women are supposed to be equals, they have no right to vote in the committee. The Club has a number of Sports' Leagues like cribbage, darts, dominoes snooker and nine pin bowling. 2 There is also a Waterside Model Club. It is a club for working models, or static models (non Working). The most popular is radio control as it can be used in cars, boats, planes, submarines or helicopters. 3 Dibden Golf Course is a large luxurious course and also has a 9-hole putting green. Food and drinks are available from the bar. Children are also welcome.
